Same problem here. Searched the web and found nothing about this problem.

Found out how to fix the problem in my above post:

I fixed mine by holding down the SHIFT key when launching Painter.  It will ask you to reset Painter, select YES.  Launches fine from then on in.  No need to use the shift key from this point on.

You will get the damaged disk error when opening the DMG, but open anyway and it will install.  Use the shift key when opening the program first time to restore the defaults.  The listed S/N does work. The program seems to run as it should.
